This really isn't a "koolflow" of any kind.

Review text: I purchased (2) King Eden pillows almost 2 years ago. I still rave about these pillows. Back then, it was made in the USA- now it’s made in China. The quality of the foam filling has also taken a dive. Look at the older Coop pillow with solid foam in it. Then look at the extra Oomph they sell now. The older pillow has solid pieces of foam & cooling gel throughout the entire pillow- now it’s mixed with synthetic shredded down. It’s completely different and the quality difference is pretty obvious. It’s really a disgrace when a company sells out for cheaper materials and cheaper labor when they had the perfect product! It’s not just cheaper, it’s also 1,000 times less comfortable. I’m so disappointed!, Please refer to the photos to see the difference. The 2 year old Coop pillow (best pillow ever), has the quality foam material they used to use with NO CHEAP SHREDDED DOWN ALTERNATIVE. Right next to it, you can see the cheaper shredded synthetic down filler with less foam they use now. Please also see old pillow case tag: made in USA- look at your Coop pillow now; it’s made in China., It’s really sad that a pillow this expensive would sellout & screw their customers. I bought 2 Coop Eden pillows from Amazon recently that will be returned, and I purchased 4 bags of extra Oomph from Coop that will be returned! Coop should be ashamed of themselves!

        }
Review text: This is my 3rd Coop Pillow. The first purchased in 2019 or 20. My most recent Coop pillow purchase (summer 23) is SIGNIFICANTLY lower quality in all areas. The textile components of the outer shell casing feel and look cheaper. The biggest and most egregious change is in the filling. In the original (older) Coop pillows the filling was a blue-ish foam sliced and diced into various bits all smaller than a quarter and interspersed with a small amount of poly fill fluff to kind of fill in the gaps between the edges of the foam. Together it created a nice supportive foam pillow that didn't feel lumpy. Now the filling is a different foam. They may say it's the same but it is now white and cut in pretty much uniform cubes. The real problem is that the filling is now SIGNIFICANTLY more poly fill fluff like you find in any average pillow. The ratio is way off and I think it's safe to assume that plastic fluff strands are cheaper than foam therefore the company increased the ratio of fluff to foam to reduce their costs. Just like they cheapened the case materials. This increase of poly fluff and decrease of foam makes the pillow blocky, hard, and it lacks the 'sink' and molding the original pillows had. This is a clear case of a company cutting on materials, making a cheaper, subpar product, while keeping the branding and reputation of an earlier, superior product. I'm so disappointed because the earlier Coop pillows were the BEST. Now I would say this pillow is the same quality as some TJ Maxx unknown brand sale "memory foam" pillow you pay $37 bucks for and still think it's too expensive for what it is. Terrible changes. Would love to know if anyone found a brand that produces pillows nearly identical to the OG Coop pillows.

QA_Content: The user has mentioned that the textile components of the outer shell casing feel and look cheaper.

Review text: I was finally able to get it right with this pillow!  I had tried multiple pillows including Purple Harmony, Sleep Comfort Plush Ultimate, and Big brand and could not find a comfortable sleep.  I would end up with neckaches and headaches., However, this pillow works!  The adjustability is the key!  I appreciate that they offer instructions about how to get the right loft and how your body should be aligned while sleeping.  I followed those instructions using my smartphone camera to check the alignment, and then I adjusted over a few days taking out a bit more poof here and there until I got it right.  I also appreciate that there is a firmer side and a softer side to this pillow.  I realized the firmer side works best for me and gives me the best support while still being cushiony soft at the right loft., "This is my first crescent pillow.  It took a few days to get used to it, but it works quite well for my side sleeping. It enables me to snuggle deeper into the pillow. Im not sure that I can ever go back to a regular pillow for side sleeping after this one. I also find the cooling of the Eden+ to be real.  The cooling doesnt last long, but it definitely feels cool to the touch when I initially lay my head on it.", "I actually ended up buying a second Coop pillow because I realized I need a different loft when lying on my back reading, meditating, or on my tablet. This typically occurs before I go to sleep and after I wake up in the morning. I got the regular Eden pillow and adjusted it to a good loft for lying on my back.  Thus, I sleep with the regular Eden pillow adjusted for my back as Im reading before i go to sleep.  Once I can no longer keep my eyes open, I switch to the Eden+ crescent pillow for sleeping on my side.", Finally, I let the pillow air out after opening but went ahead and slept on it the first night.  I then let it continue airing out the second day. I did not have major issues with foam smell., I am glad to have found this very customizable pillow and some relief for my neck and back!

Review text:
This is my first shredded memory foam pillow and boy is it different from the usual pillow.

Once it's all "inflated" it is hard and functions like clay - when you lay your head on it it VERY SLOWLY comforms to your head.

This means as you turn over and want to reposition your head you have to deal with a hard pileup of material that only gradually accommodates your head.

Maybe that's how this kind of pillow is supposed to work

but it's weird for me.

Review text:
These are high quality and well constructed.  

But ultra ultra firm.  

When you lay on them very firm not fluffy at all.

Yet after about thirty minutes the area your head is laying on is still very firm, yet almost flat with very little lift for your head.

So,  while I can say the actual construction and quality of pillows is good.

For me it is not what I need for a comfortable sleep.  

Would return if I had good transport into town to do the return.

I've had apnea for a couple years, and have used a number of different pillows searching for the best.

I've found it.

I use the large "fighter pilot" mask.

Obviously can't sleep on my stomach.

Sleeping on my back greatly increases the "incidents", so I'm a side sleeper.

, First I tried the pillow, and had limited success as delivered.

It was too high and too firm.

Then I removed 8 to 10 cups of the inner foam and hit the sweet spot.

Review text:
It is super supportive of my neck which used to be a problem with other pillow brands at this price point.

Good value out of this two pack.

They arrive rolled up but just toss them in the dryer for a few minutes on low heat, let sit for about half an hour and they will be fluffed, ready to go.

Pillow feels solid enough but not where it stresses your neck out.

You sink in just enough to feel comfortable.

The cool side actually works as well.

I cannot feel a difference between the "cool" side and the normal cotton side through a simple pillow case. Also, because the fabric used is very satin-like in texture, my pillow case inevitably wriggles off the pillow while I sleep. It's disappointing to know that I now need to invest in cotton pillow protectors to prevent my pillow cases from slipping off, another investment I wasn't expecting., "Overall its a decent product but I wish I had done more research before selecting these pillows. I get an instant migraine.

Had the smell been documented in the description I would not have purchased this product.

I ordered 4 of these pillows after losing hope in so many other brands.

I would go through 2-3 sets of pillows a year because they would get so flat after such a short period of time.

These are hotel quality, with the perfect soft/firmness.

I’ve had them for over a month now and they still feel the same as the day I got them!

Highly recommend!

Great product!

(:

I cant see myself paying 100 dollars as the original price but definitely worth buying for 30-35 dollars for two pillows. Review text:
If I could give DOUBLE 0 stars I would!!

These are definitely NOT WORTH IT!!

RUN DO NOT BUY!!

Right out of the package I fluffed and put my hand on it.

I could feel my other hand on the other side!

It went straight down, like no cotton was even there.

How in the world do these pillows have that many stars and that many great comments?

Well I guess if you like sleeping on your mattress without a pillow this would be for you.

Returned, with no problem.

You want it to begin expanding & can take up to 24hrs to expand., Material:, The external fabric of the pillow is soft but not cheap & thin. Review text: "When new pop your pillows with plastic removed of course into a low to medium drier and run 10 to 15 minutes. You may add a damp wash cloth not wet just damp that might help too and this also helps sanitize the pillows the longer you run them. Depending on size of drier drum you may need to run a single pillow at a time and especially if they are King sized. My drier holds two queens prefect with room to spare. Like so many finding the pillow thats just right is not easy. Weve had them now and again over the years but over the 52 years weve been married even the perfect ones wear out. So here we go shopping again. Buying in stores is no absolute certain they will be perfect when you get home. In our case nearest stores are 100 miles away so round trip of 200 often sends us to on line shop. I bought a pair of these in the larger Queen today the 20x30 not the 20x28 which is also an option. And even with king bed we find a king pillow too BIG. So Ive been known to shorten a flatter filled pillow thats a King to make it a queen. I know...our job as a consumer in the USA or anywhere is to outsmart the offerings that are substandard some times. Today I bought the pair of these PLUS the same brand of shredded memory foam pillows. The memory foam filled shred is set up with zipper to remove or add more shredding. I have similar pillows and use them for large designed reading pillows and bolsters on day beds outdoors under covered patio. Yes these are 40x80 inch aluminum base made for outdoor furniture use. I replace the original cushions comfortable to sit on but not sleep on with real mattresses that I covered with fully zippered water proof pack cloth thats worked extremely well. Turned out the FIRM mattresses were not great to sit on so ended up having to soften them with mattress toppers but that works out fine. I cut extra big King size quilted coverlets or quilts in two and they make the most lovely matching covers along with having 4 King size shams that I make the over stuffed inserts using the shredded memory foam. I often add a core of regular foam rectangle centered and surrounded by the foam and also wrap a layer of polyester batting around all before sewing a cover up around it. I find these will machine wash well if you choose quality fabric and the foam core stays secure or has for years now. All new products and custom made to meet our needs. So I got a little off the price by buying both of these queen pillows in pairs today. Only 10% but hey not bad and both pillows were suppose to be on sale by 15% off too. Who knows if thats for real or not. I took advantage just the same and ordered all 4 pillows for just under 60.00. I also have a 22 year old RV Class B+ we are rebuilding and updating and Im making all new upholstered furniture and redesigned the sofa too so I can always use a bit more pillow stuffing if these fail as bed pillows I will use the filling to its fullest ability just the same. Yes you can buy cheap cheap cheap pillows at discount stores but often as not the stuffing is so lacking in par so to speak you are better off buying poly fill from a sewing store and making your own. Not all filling is equal. Not all feathers or down is either. Anyway heres a KEY to both types of pillows and ALL pillows bought on line or not but that arrive vacuumed sealed up....give them a few hours to expand and then place in your drier on low heat and run 10-20 minutes. Dont use high heat though my drier medium works fine as actually does air some of the time but not for the foam pillows. If you like add a damp not wet face cloth to the drier with the pillows but do not add softening sheet...unless you might want to add scented something. Im ultra sensitive to scented anything so never use such. Your pillows should come put super fluffed and fully expanded. If your drier is not xl sized drum you may want to do one pillow at a time or if they are King pillows also one at a time. It amazes me how many people sleep on the vacuumed seal pillows the first night and never allow them to fully develop shape again and complain they bottomed out. The drier now and again also is helpful to just fluff up a pillow that appears to have delfated maybe due to sweating or over use over time it can happen. I often wash my husbands pillow and he dislikes a fat pillow so it comes out of the drier FAT. I put it in an anti allergy cover with zipper flatten it down and zip up the allergy cover and surprises how well this keeps the pillow flattened out for a day or two until the pillow relaxes back to my husbands happy head and neck size. I then next time I change the cases can open the zipper on the extra cover a few inches so it now lets out more air and forms nicely to his comfort and he never seems to be the wiser with no grumpy hubby. The things we dont do for our love ones. Anyway try the drier trick for new pillows with or without a damp face rag to add a bit of moisture which can help with the fluffing. Also at medium heat it helps to sanitize a new pillow which can be a plus not knowing where or how it was made and what conditions the factory is.  Happy dreams everyone and may you find that perfect pillow thats just right for you. Maybe heaven is having a perfect pillow forever. I wonder?  Yes I was redundant about directions with drier use. But Im in my 70s and hubby well into 90s repeating is common practice."

Review text: I bought these pillows about 11 months ago, and I can say that they are still exactly the same full shape and fluffiness that they were when I first got them. I use them every single night, and I never have to bunch them up or fluff them out., I will say that I am a predominantly side-sleeper, so I got the firm version of the pillows and they work very well for me - back sleepers may want the soft version, as when I do make the attempt to sleep on my back, I find the firmness makes my upper back feel a little tight after an hour or so., "Truly Im amazed at how long these pillows have retained their shape; I usually start to see pillows lose shape or firmness after about 4 to 6 months of continual use. Review text: "When new pop your pillows with plastic removed of course into a low to medium drier and run 10 to 15 minutes. You may add a damp wash cloth not wet just damp that might help too and this also helps sanitize the pillows the longer you run them. Depending on size of drier drum you may need to run a single pillow at a time and especially if they are King sized. My drier holds two queens prefect with room to spare. Like so many finding the pillow thats just right is not easy. Weve had them now and again over the years but over the 52 years weve been married even the perfect ones wear out. So here we go shopping again. Buying in stores is no absolute certain they will be perfect when you get home. In our case nearest stores are 100 miles away so round trip of 200 often sends us to on line shop. I bought a pair of these in the larger Queen today the 20x30 not the 20x28 which is also an option. And even with king bed we find a king pillow too BIG. So Ive been known to shorten a flatter filled pillow thats a King to make it a queen. I know...our job as a consumer in the USA or anywhere is to outsmart the offerings that are substandard some times. Today I bought the pair of these PLUS the same brand of shredded memory foam pillows. The memory foam filled shred is set up with zipper to remove or add more shredding. I have similar pillows and use them for large designed reading pillows and bolsters on day beds outdoors under covered patio. Yes these are 40x80 inch aluminum base made for outdoor furniture use. I replace the original cushions comfortable to sit on but not sleep on with real mattresses that I covered with fully zippered water proof pack cloth thats worked extremely well. Turned out the FIRM mattresses were not great to sit on so ended up having to soften them with mattress toppers but that works out fine. I cut extra big King size quilted coverlets or quilts in two and they make the most lovely matching covers along with having 4 King size shams that I make the over stuffed inserts using the shredded memory foam. I often add a core of regular foam rectangle centered and surrounded by the foam and also wrap a layer of polyester batting around all before sewing a cover up around it. I find these will machine wash well if you choose quality fabric and the foam core stays secure or has for years now. All new products and custom made to meet our needs. So I got a little off the price by buying both of these queen pillows in pairs today. Only 10% but hey not bad and both pillows were suppose to be on sale by 15% off too. Who knows if thats for real or not. I took advantage just the same and ordered all 4 pillows for just under 60.00. I also have a 22 year old RV Class B+ we are rebuilding and updating and Im making all new upholstered furniture and redesigned the sofa too so I can always use a bit more pillow stuffing if these fail as bed pillows I will use the filling to its fullest ability just the same. Yes you can buy cheap cheap cheap pillows at discount stores but often as not the stuffing is so lacking in par so to speak you are better off buying poly fill from a sewing store and making your own. Not all filling is equal. Not all feathers or down is either. Anyway heres a KEY to both types of pillows and ALL pillows bought on line or not but that arrive vacuumed sealed up....give them a few hours to expand and then place in your drier on low heat and run 10-20 minutes. Dont use high heat though my drier medium works fine as actually does air some of the time but not for the foam pillows. If you like add a damp not wet face cloth to the drier with the pillows but do not add softening sheet...unless you might want to add scented something. Im ultra sensitive to scented anything so never use such. Your pillows should come put super fluffed and fully expanded. If your drier is not xl sized drum you may want to do one pillow at a time or if they are King pillows also one at a time. It amazes me how many people sleep on the vacuumed seal pillows the first night and never allow them to fully develop shape again and complain they bottomed out. The drier now and again also is helpful to just fluff up a pillow that appears to have delfated maybe due to sweating or over use over time it can happen. I often wash my husbands pillow and he dislikes a fat pillow so it comes out of the drier FAT. I put it in an anti allergy cover with zipper flatten it down and zip up the allergy cover and surprises how well this keeps the pillow flattened out for a day or two until the pillow relaxes back to my husbands happy head and neck size. I then next time I change the cases can open the zipper on the extra cover a few inches so it now lets out more air and forms nicely to his comfort and he never seems to be the wiser with no grumpy hubby. The things we dont do for our love ones. Anyway try the drier trick for new pillows with or without a damp face rag to add a bit of moisture which can help with the fluffing. Also at medium heat it helps to sanitize a new pillow which can be a plus not knowing where or how it was made and what conditions the factory is.  Happy dreams everyone and may you find that perfect pillow thats just right for you. Maybe heaven is having a perfect pillow forever. I wonder?  Yes I was redundant about directions with drier use. But Im in my 70s and hubby well into 90s repeating is common practice."

Review text:
", To fluff these pillows I put them in a air fluff setting on my dryer, you can opt for a tumble dry or a low hear setting.

Leaving them in for even 10 minutes does a great job.

Once they come out I do still shake them out and hit them a little to get them to fully fluff up.

After they are used it is a good rule of thumb to put them in direct sunlight to get them back to where they need to be between dryer fluffs.

Overall great pillows.

Review text: These are a good quality pillow for the price. I have bought TONS of pillows and none of them work for a decent night sleep. I am a back sleeper and a large person, so most pillows go flat after a couple hours, but these actually stay very fluffy all night. The people who say they are flat probably did not prep them properly. After opening them (which was a bit difficult), I let them come to life and uncompact themselves for about a half hour, then I shook them and manipulated the foam pieces inside. I then put them in the dryer with 3 dryer balls for 10 minutes and they were very poofy and fluffy and have remained that way. I received them a week ago. I would definitely buy them again and I recommend them for anyone who likes a fluffy but somewhat firm pillow that does not flatten overnight.

"Being a side sleeper I wanted softness, support, and adjustability.

Review text: These are a good quality pillow for the price. I have bought TONS of pillows and none of them work for a decent night sleep. I am a back sleeper and a large person, so most pillows go flat after a couple hours, but these actually stay very fluffy all night. The people who say they are flat probably did not prep them properly. After opening them (which was a bit difficult), I let them come to life and uncompact themselves for about a half hour, then I shook them and manipulated the foam pieces inside. I then put them in the dryer with 3 dryer balls for 10 minutes and they were very poofy and fluffy and have remained that way. I received them a week ago. I would definitely buy them again and I recommend them for anyone who likes a fluffy but somewhat firm pillow that does not flatten overnight.

Review text:
This pillow is stuffed with small, almost ripped up pieces of memory foam.

It is very comfortable around the head, however it bunches up really weird if you move around a lot.

I like to sleep fairly close to my headboard, and this pillow turns into a flat triangle when it squishes against it.

I have to punch it down fairly often just to get it to lay even again.

I bought the "Less Stuffed" pillow in Queen size 👑 and there is no zipper.  

It smells nice, the bamboo cover is breathable, soft, and looks nice even after a few nights of sleep, but it is too thick of a pillow for me to sleep on my back.  

I can make a hole in the foam by manipulating it through the fabric of the pillow but it's still way more stuffed than I was hoping and the zipper (clearly show in the second picture) is not real.

Review text: "These are nice, cushy feeling pillows that arent too soft or too squishy. I am mostly a side sleeper, but Im also very restless and toss and turn a lot. So, I like to have several different types of pillows on my bed. I also prefer a king or queen sized pillow, but I was offered this set of pillows in a standard size for review. They are properly sized and they look and feel full, but they are not over-stuffed so they fit my standard sized pillowcases well.", I find them quite comfortable and although the pillows are light-weight, soft and provide only light support, they don't flatten out too much during the course of the night, and they easily return to the original size and shape. The product description mentions that the pillows offer a balance between "supple softness and plump firmness" and they do have an airy sort of plumpness from the down-like gel fibers. Which I really like because true down pillows are so pricey, and feather/down pillows are heavy and uncomfortable for me. But the pillows don't really feel supple or firm to me at all. They do have enough fill so I don't sink too deeply into the pillows and they feel springy so I can scrunch them up enough to keep my arm under the pillow comfortably., I found the pillows to be breathable, which is great for me, because I tend to develop an earache when sleeping on my side for any length of time if a pillow is too dense., "I wouldnt say these are exactly luxury or hotel-quality pillows. They seem like every-day pillows to me. They are not gusseted which is nice for side-sleepers and the cover feels nice and smooth, but it is a polyester blend and I would have preferred 100% cotton.", The pillows arrived very well packaged, clean and in perfect condition, which I appreciated. There is a tough outer plastic wrap and inside, each pillow is separately rolled in an individual plastic sheath surrounding the vacuum pack. I fluffed them up after opening and allowed them to rest and air out for a full 24 hours as suggested, before using them.

Review text: There is one supreme pillow on the earth…and this, my friends, is NOT it! I do agree with the other reviewers that these pillows are very soft (to the touch, but not in firmness.) These feel great, fluff up nicely and provide a comfy support. Unfortunately, that’s not ALL I’m looking for in a pillow. I want more!, These are not good for me. I’m a side sleeper, and after sleeping on this pillow, I woke up many times through the night, to adjust my position. My neck and back ached through the last few hours of my sleep, until finally, I had to get out of bed. Not great, right? Nope., Like I said, there is one supreme pillow brand, that reigns above them all, and those are the ones found at Hampton Inn Hotels. I thought that perhaps, these might come close, (based on so many positive reviews) but boy was I wrong. These are way too firm for me (even though they are labeled as “soft.” So I will be returning these, and buying my pillows directly from the shop Hampton site (something I didn’t even know was possible until today.) After trying another hotel brand, then MyPillow, and now these, I’m not messing around any more. I’m going to pay for comfort and peaceful sleep! These are being returned tomorrow.

Review text:
It was one solid piece and infused with cooling gel so I figured Id give it a try.

I normally get very hot during the night.

To my surprise, this pillow was actually very cool when I first lay down on it.

If I have the AC on, this pillow starts out actually quite cold!

It doesnt stay cold all night because it does absorb my body heat, but if it starts out in and air conditioned room, it is a cold pillow.

And I can sleep for hours without my ear being all squashed when I wake up.

This pillow has a cushioned waterproof pillow protector, to avoid feeling the lumpy shredded foam pillow inside.

However, once you move your head around on the protective cover you can feel the waterproof material crunch, which makes for a slightly noisy and warm sleep.

A cushioned 100% cotton pillow protector would have been better; stains could wash out easily; and you would get a more comfortable and cooling sleep.

The two-pillow deal arrived in a very small but heavy box.  

Hard to believe it would contain two queen pillows but upon opening the box, two pillows fell out.  

Following the instructions I washed and air-dried the pillow cases while waiting the required 48 hours for the pillow material to fully recover its shape and size.

Worth it!

Review text: Honestly, I have been through so many pillows. I have a few herniated discs in my lower C / upper T and consistently have flare ups a few times a year from sleeping wrong,  weather changes, stress, workouts, etc. this pillow is great because you can adjust the foam inside very easily. Remove as much as you need or add more depending on your comfort level. The C curve is everything! It fits snuggly around your neck and supports in all the right places. I am mostly a side sleeper but occasionally drift on to my back and it’s still great! Worth it! I have also been using it for a few months ( before writing this) and the foam is holding up nicely. It’s easy to push around if it gets out of place but I rarely need to do this. Hope this helps someone else! I understand the pain and despair in wasting so much $$ on the wrong pillows!

Review text: I was very hesitant but need new pillows and I am somewhat large man with very heavy bone structure.  With that said most pillows don’t last, they are usually broke by the first week.  With memory foam I was worried it would not hold up to the weight density of my head causing my head pinch nerves in my neck.  I was wrong the first night I could tell is supported my head without being hard and the fact you are able to adjust the fill level is amazing. Usually I have to fold pillow to support my head and even then I still get pinched nerves in my neck and should.  I was amazed how well it kept my head in perfect alignment for me.  I used the second one to support my body when I sleep on my side and it worked like nothing has ever done before.  I have woken up with no pinched nerves no numbness.  I’m in heaven

HIGHLY recommned this pillow."

Review text:
Waited to review after sleeping on these for over a week.

They are incredibly comfortable.

I expected to have to take some filling out (I’m only 5’2) but they’re comfortable as they are.  

I had been sleeping on more expensive tempurpedic pillows and they were causing headaches and knots in my neck/back.

Review text: I ordered these pillows and had the WORST allergic reaction. Initially, I was so happy to receive these and the feel of the exterior is just as described with good quality texture. However, I started noticing an allergies and couldn't pinpoint the source. By the end of the 24 hour "airing out", I fluffed and placed these in pillow sheets and attempted to get peaceful rest. Boy was I wrong. There is something these pillows contain that triggered me right into throat closure, immense itching, burning and inflammation of my eyes. I could hardly breathe. Luckily my sister came to assist, removed the pillows, took lots of medication and still struggling the following day however on the mends. Very unfortunate to miss a full day of holiday time with my family due to the reaction of this. I have never had any sorts of an allergic reaction to anything aside from certain medications.

Review text: Ordered standard 26 X20... measures 23 X 19. Looks ridiculous on a normal size bed.  Advertised 15% down, label says otherwise. As far as the size, give me a break...

Review text: They’re NOT medium-firm, despite what the info says. They are clean, and they don’t have a smell. They are fluffy. They seem decent quality. However: They are WAY too soft, with very little support. These are the quality of the “soft” down hotel pillows, maybe, but not the supportive ones. If I would have been able to feel them in the store, I’d not have bought them. I’m keeping them because they’re somewhat better than my last set of pillows that I bought online, and I need a pillow until I can buy some true medium-firm ones that work. But no more online pillow purchases for me. I’m heading for the store soon.

I asked my husband what he likes about this pillow to justify the price tag.

He said " size, shape and firmness".

Honestly I like these pillows for sitting up and reading a book but they are too firm and thick for me to sleep with, but he loves them and honestly seems to have less back issues since he started using them, enough that I came back for another one this summer.

The zipper is nice for taking off the cover and giving it a wash and it all goes back on pretty easy.

10/10

Review text: After sleeping on this pillow for a couple of months now, I can say that it definitely supports your neck if you sleep on your side., Although it takes some time for your head to sink in, it conforms to your head and supports it nicely. It isn’t too soft, but it isn’t super hard either as I don’t have to fight it to get my head positioned., I don’t stay on one side throughout the night and would consider myself a “roller” since I roll from one side, to my back, and then to the other side and vice versa throughout the night. This pillow is great for side sleeping, but it probably isn’t ideal for back sleepers. The pillow is just firm enough to fill the shoulder gap for side sleepers, but slightly too firm to be comfortable when sleeping on your back., As for the pillow itself, it’s foam with a removable pillow covering like any other pillow. You can wash the covering if you stain it. The foam is memory foam and relatively cool because it’s made with a grid of holes in the material to promote airflow and temperature regulation., Overall, I’m happy with this pillow and it supports my side very well. The material is the perfect combination of soft and firm. Temperature has never been an issue to me, either. I recommend this pillow if you’re a side sleeper!

Review text:
I asked my husband what he likes about this pillow to justify the price tag.

He said " size, shape and firmness".

Honestly I like these pillows for sitting up and reading a book but they are too firm and thick for me to sleep with, but he loves them and honestly seems to have less back issues since he started using them, enough that I came back for another one this summer.

The zipper is nice for taking off the cover and giving it a wash and it all goes back on pretty easy.

10/10

Review text: "These pillows were vacuumed sealed upon arrival so I opened them and let them adjust to our home temperature for about 24 hours. I also ran them on our dryers antibacterial cycle just to make sure they were free from all germs. I was looking for something soft to medium but these were almost too soft. They were like laying on a cloud but you would need to use both if you want any type of neck support for sleeping. Unfortunately they wont work for my nightly needs but I did move them to our guest room and over the Thanksgiving holiday my in-laws stayed for 3 days and said they were very comfortable. So a win is a win!"

Review text: The filling of this pillow upon fluffing and using honestly feels more like down alternative than actual feather/down. I have several full down and down/feather combo pillows and the feel is quite different from this one. This one is more bouncy, like a down alternative pillow. I can feel some feathers, so I’m sure they are there but I’m not sure that there isn’t something unnatural mixed in there… the listing has different descriptions of the filling in different places. It says 80% feather and 15% down in one place, 100% feather and down in another, and then 85% feather 15% down in yet another place. Then the tag reads 80% feather, 15% down, and 5% microfiber. At first I assumed the 5% microfiber referred to the case (which might be true), but after feeling the pillow and comparing to both down/feather and down alternative pillows I already own, I’m not convinced that there isn’t down-alternative mixed into the filling and accounting for the unnatural bounciness of this pillow. Maybe that’s not the case  - I am not a pillow expert but I feel that others should be aware that this may not feel just like another 85/15 feather/down mix.  All that being said, the pillow itself is not bad for the price I paid. I needed a soft pillow quickly and this one was a good value that met my immediate needs. It’s loftier than other feather/down pillows I own, but seems to smush down enough without completely flattening. Perhaps the seller can clarify the filling contents in their listing., Update: After using this pillow a few more times, I have to add this although this pillow feels soft when you hug it with your hands, it is more of a firm pillow when sleeping on it. I have sensitive outer ears and sleep on my side. I usually require a soft down/feather or memory foam pillow to avoid ear pain. This pillow gives me quite a bit of ear pain. To me that implies that the pillow is overly firm for my needs. If you have sensitive ears, this may not be the pillow for you.

Review text: "First of all, I normally dont review pillows, because every person is different. A hard pillow can fill medium to some a soft pillow can be to hard for others, so this is my first pillow review. But I wanted to do this for anyone in my situation.", I have Thoracic Outlet syndrome TOS. Which causes my hands to go numb at night and tingle, the two extra ribs in my neck have drove me nuts for years. Waking up 6 times a night just to get in the right position to sleep. That position was always on my side for the past 12 or so years., I have tired every pillow on the market, found some that helped for a few months, but then the TOS would act up again. Saying all this to get on to the review for me alone. Everyone is different., First night with this pillow., Slept good all night last night, but woke up several times trying to sleep on my side, the pillow kept me on my back, I tried to roll over, but kept waking up. Not sure why, but that pillow wanted me on my back. The good news is, my hands only went numb and tingled once, and that was very mild compared to most times. Anyone living with this understands., "Not sure if Im keeping it at this point, but I do like it. Just not sure it is the right pillow for me with my issue.", On a side note, if it matters, my neck moved like I was at a chiro today. So I will give this pillow a few more nights., Just a small update., I had to send the pillow back, just could not get comfortable sleeping on my back.

Review text: The filling of this pillow upon fluffing and using honestly feels more like down alternative than actual feather/down. I have several full down and down/feather combo pillows and the feel is quite different from this one. This one is more bouncy, like a down alternative pillow. I can feel some feathers, so I’m sure they are there but I’m not sure that there isn’t something unnatural mixed in there… the listing has different descriptions of the filling in different places. It says 80% feather and 15% down in one place, 100% feather and down in another, and then 85% feather 15% down in yet another place. Then the tag reads 80% feather, 15% down, and 5% microfiber. At first I assumed the 5% microfiber referred to the case (which might be true), but after feeling the pillow and comparing to both down/feather and down alternative pillows I already own, I’m not convinced that there isn’t down-alternative mixed into the filling and accounting for the unnatural bounciness of this pillow. Maybe that’s not the case  - I am not a pillow expert but I feel that others should be aware that this may not feel just like another 85/15 feather/down mix.  All that being said, the pillow itself is not bad for the price I paid. I needed a soft pillow quickly and this one was a good value that met my immediate needs. It’s loftier than other feather/down pillows I own, but seems to smush down enough without completely flattening. Perhaps the seller can clarify the filling contents in their listing., Update: After using this pillow a few more times, I have to add this although this pillow feels soft when you hug it with your hands, it is more of a firm pillow when sleeping on it. I have sensitive outer ears and sleep on my side. I usually require a soft down/feather or memory foam pillow to avoid ear pain. This pillow gives me quite a bit of ear pain. To me that implies that the pillow is overly firm for my needs. If you have sensitive ears, this may not be the pillow for you.

Review text:
This pillow is not your typical “soft” pillow.

It feels quite firm and almost like a paper bag on the outside.

The pillow itself once you’re laying down is supportive enough and I do get a good nights sleep but it is not as springy as I’d like.

Overall it’s an interesting combination and I’m not sure how to feel about it or if its description is accurate.

Not for those looking for that fluffy and soft hotel pillow.

It’s like a fluffy pillow with a hard shell.

Review text:
I have a Coop Home Good Pillow that I love and the BETU is an excellent knock-off.

It has a secondary casing that is very soft and breathable.

It comes with extra foam if you want to make it firmer.

However, I found that the existing foam is far more than I needed and removed some.

I ran it through a couple of "freshen up" cycles in the dryer and that knocked out 80% of the foam order with the rest dissipating in a few days.

I think it offers great support and comfort for the price.

Review text:
I have a Coop Home Good Pillow that I love and the BETU is an excellent knock-off.

It has a secondary casing that is very soft and breathable.

It comes with extra foam if you want to make it firmer.

However, I found that the existing foam is far more than I needed and removed some.

I ran it through a couple of "freshen up" cycles in the dryer and that knocked out 80% of the foam order with the rest dissipating in a few days.

I think it offers great support and comfort for the price.

Review text: "The box pillow came in a small box.  It is a foam cube inside of a pillow case with zipper. What I noticed right afer this enlargement was a smell kind of like a hobby glue or maybe turpentine (we all smell things differently) that permeated the pillow cover which was around the foam.  Took off the pillow case and discovered that the smell was coming from the foam inside.  What to do. Return means findiing a larger box.", So went to the product makers website through Amazon and this is some of the Chat, like chat because it gives a text to refer to at a later time.  The answer shown here, surrounded by """, was right away so this situation must exist with other purchasers:, """ System (Pillow Cube), Nov 3, 2023, 12:36'u202fPM MDT, (12:34:19'u202fPM) *** John joined the chat ***, (12:34:20'u202fPM) John: Just opened up a pillow cube ordered through Amazon. Weve seen that if the pillow is packaged quickly after the foam is made, it will have a stronger smell.", Luckily, the smell WILL go away. The easiest way to speed up that process is by setting the foam core out in the sun in the open air until the smell has dissipated. We'd also recommend washing the pillowcase and pillow cover. """, After two weeks of putting the foam out in the sun and later letting it sit out in the garage and then later in the house there is still a slight lingering smell. Review text: I’ve been looking for a pillow that is firm, cooling and provides the right amount of support for side sleeping.  I thought a cube shaped pillow would be a gimmick but after watching their video, i decided to give it a try because it looked like it actually could do what they say it does.  I ordered my pillow and it came flattened and vacuum sealed.  After removing it from the vacuum seal, it plumped immediately.  It did have a slight chemically smell but that dissipated quickly.  After two nights sleeping with the pillow I realized I had ordered the wrong size for my height. I ordered regular size for individuals over 5’ 3”.  I am 5’1” and I found that the pillow was too thick so I wasn’t getting the proper alignment. So when you order, be sure to make sure you order the correct size pillow for the height/size.  I sized down to the thin, which turned out to be perfect.  Upon opening the pillow, I did feel like the thin wasn’t has firm as the standard but it turned out to be fine.  The pillow looks like a cute rectangular block.  The pillow casing is very soft and cool to the touch.  I will say that the pillow does stay cool for a very long time.  When I’m ready to sleep, I tuck the pillow between my shoulder against my neck.  Once I lay my head down on the cool pillow, I fall asleep pretty fast. The pillow is comfortable and most importantly, the firmness is giving me the proper support to keep my spine aligned.  So far I’ve been sleeping on this pillow for about a month and I really love it.  Most pillows lose their firmness and therefore lose the head and neck support.  I have high hopes that this pillow will remain firm for a long time.  I’ll try to remember to do an update after 6 months of using this pillow.  For now, it’s definitely a recommend from me!

QA_Content: The user has mentioned that the pillow is comfortable and the firmness is providing proper support to keep his spine aligned.
Processed_QA_Content: The pillow is comfortable and provides proper support to keep my spine aligned.
accept1: The pillow is comfortable and provides proper support to keep my spine aligned.

Review text: I’ve been looking for a pillow that is firm, cooling and provides the right amount of support for side sleeping.  I thought a cube shaped pillow would be a gimmick but after watching their video, i decided to give it a try because it looked like it actually could do what they say it does.  I ordered my pillow and it came flattened and vacuum sealed.  After removing it from the vacuum seal, it plumped immediately.  It did have a slight chemically smell but that dissipated quickly.  After two nights sleeping with the pillow I realized I had ordered the wrong size for my height. I ordered regular size for individuals over 5’ 3”.  I am 5’1” and I found that the pillow was too thick so I wasn’t getting the proper alignment. So when you order, be sure to make sure you order the correct size pillow for the height/size.  I sized down to the thin, which turned out to be perfect.  Upon opening the pillow, I did feel like the thin wasn’t has firm as the standard but it turned out to be fine.  The pillow looks like a cute rectangular block.  The pillow casing is very soft and cool to the touch.  I will say that the pillow does stay cool for a very long time.  When I’m ready to sleep, I tuck the pillow between my shoulder against my neck.  Once I lay my head down on the cool pillow, I fall asleep pretty fast. The pillow is comfortable and most importantly, the firmness is giving me the proper support to keep my spine aligned.  So far I’ve been sleeping on this pillow for about a month and I really love it.  Most pillows lose their firmness and therefore lose the head and neck support.  I have high hopes that this pillow will remain firm for a long time.  I’ll try to remember to do an update after 6 months of using this pillow.  For now, it’s definitely a recommend from me!

QA_Content: The reviewer mentioned that the pillow stays cool for a long time, indicating good breathability.
Processed_QA_Content: I found the pillow to stay cool for a long time, indicating good breathability.
accept1: I found the pillow to stay cool for a long time, indicating good breathability.

Review text: I've been using these pillows for four months now... These are plump pillows that retain their firmness and are fine right out of the box or with the added filling. After searching extensively for pillows with a good amount of loft, to better support my neck, these fit the bill. I've gone through many pillows that begin lofty but eventually (usually immediately) lay flat as a plate, which can leave me with a sore neck, when I don't acclimate well to the lack of support. Now, there's no longer a need to stack my pillows; which never was an efficient approach, anyway, with those previous pillows. At a length of roughly ≈ 28" and with a girth or loft of ≈ 9" it can be tough to squeeze these into queen sized pillow cases, but if the cases have securing pockets you will be able to jam them completely inside your case. The supplied outer casing is quality and does not tear or wear down over time (It's also easily washable). So, if you like a good amount of support for your neck, head; then consider giving these a try!

Highly recommended!

The material of the outer cover is very soft and comfortable.

Review text: So, Bed Bath & Beyond closed recently and I was devastated. I got a specific pillow there which I've had for at least 3 years that isn't made anymore even direct supply from the manufacturer! When I needed a new pillow, I was worried I wouldn't find a dense, firm pillow with cooling like my old one had. While it's not exactly the same, this pillow is a pretty darn good replacement. I'm a side sleeper with shoulder and neck issues, and this pillow is a good amount of support but still comfortable enough to sleep on. I do wish it held it's shape just slightly more than it does, but it's much better than a "standard" memory foam pillow. It's not quite as cool as my old pillow (which had a layer of cooling gel on top of the pillow, this one is just built-in to the pillow itself) it does seem to keep decently cool throughout the night. I'm glad to have a decent replacement pillow, and on sale this one was half the cost of my last. I'd say it's worth trying out!

Review text: "I actually got these pillows for my son but almost kept them for myself because I like them so much!! They are incredibly comfortable. They are actually medium firm as stated. The feather pillows I am currently using are too soft so I have to use 2 together but with these I would only need one. My son was leary about switching from his shredded memory foam pillows to these but he loves them. I hate shredded memory foam pillows and have been trying to eliminate them from our house and I think these will do the trick. Everyone seems to love them.", "They are excellent quality for the price. They are stitched very well and no feathers come out of them like they do on my much more expensive feather pillows. I also love that these are washable! I also love that the cover is organic cotton and they didnt come with any weird or bad odors.", They are actually queen size 20" x 30" pillows and my pillowcases fit perfectly. They feel like they will last a long time., "Pillows are hard to buy based on reviews because everyone has a different preference but if youre a side/back sleeper and want pillows that are soft yet supportive then I definitely recommend these pillow. I will absolutely be buying more!! Hope this was helpful."

Review text: Ill admit Im pretty picky on my pillow choices. Ive ordered far too many online only to receive them and be pretty disappointed. They would either be too soft to where you would have to fold them over in half to get the thickness you wanted, or just go flat after a few months. I took another chance on these because the reviews were so good and they do not disappoint. I would say they are about as close to the higher end hotel pillows that you can get. I am very happy with my purchase and the pricing of these and will order 2 more to fill out my bed set. They are thick with just the right firmness and puff back up with a couple shakes if you feel the stuffing is starting to settle. I think this why a couple reviews are bad on here. It states also when opening up the vacuum packaging to fluff them briefly in the dryer and shake them. Some may have missed that part.

Review text: I wasn’t sure if I’d like it since this was shredded memory foam pillows and I was replacing my single piece memory foam pillows that I was very much used to.  I decided to go ahead and try it and just use them for the guest room if we didn’t like them.  Turns out that they work just fine.  My husband removed about 25% of the stuffing right away and it’s now perfect for him.  I tried full stuffing for a few nights and then removed about the same amount from my pillow.  Support is perfect. They come with cooling pillow cases that has a nice blue and white design on them and are washable.  I do notice the cooling aspect but the hubby says he doesn’t really feel any cooling.  All in all, good purchase and even though I was used to the single piece memory foam pillows, the shredded foam works for me as well.  Bonus - I used the extra stuffing to fluff up some of the couch throw pillows!

Review text:
The pillows are decent over all.

However they do not satisfy the “firm” description.

After about an hour they are flat as a board.

Well packaged and shipped relatively quickly but the gamble was on the ability to maintain firmness over night.

They are very comfortable for about 45 minutes to an hour and then I flop and flip and puff and fluff the pillow.

Not the best but not as bad as my old pillows.

Maybe I set my expectations too high.

I just want some decent sleep.

Review text: This memory foam body pillow arrived vacuum compressed, flattened, and rolled in a plastic bag and placed inside a thin fabric bag.  Upon opening it immediately started to fluff up.  It was given a full 24 hours, with two separate 20 minute sessions in the dryer on the air only setting (with dryer balls added) to get the foam to fluff up all the way.  However, it is not firm or fluffy enough and there is no additional foam to add to get it to the desired firmness., Extra shredded memory foam from another company's pillows had to be used to increase fluff/firmness.  It would have been nice if this pillow had come with a small bag of extra memory foam to increase the loft as the description states it is "adjustable".  Also, the top cover of this pillow is very soft and comfortable, and it is still useable without adding additional foam., This body pillow states that it is made with OEKO-TEX certified materials, but it does have a very minor smell to it after 24 hours.  Most memory foam pillows have this smell for the first week, so it will be left to air out for this timeframe before being used and it is expected to not have this smell given prior experiences with other memory foam pillows., If you can handle a body pillow that is slightly lacking in firmness or you have additional spare memory foam on hand, this pillow will likely work out for you.

Review text: "I wanted a set of nice pillows for my guest bedroom and these certainly fit that description. They came tightly packed and vacuum sealed. It was a little hard getting the plastic wrapping off for fear of cutting the pillow. But a little care was all it took so no big deal. They plumped up pretty quick after unpacking. They are definitely cool to the touch which I love. And, medium firmness, which I also love. I like that they come with a case that can be removed for washing. The only thing I would say, and this is hardly noticeable at all, is they have a little lumping (thats too harsh of a word) to them. I dont notice it at all when my head is on the pillow. Its just a minor appearance thing so I took off a star for that. But, otherwise they are of excellent quality and the perfect comfort for me. If I could give a 4.5, I would."

Review text: "Best pillow Ive ever owned! No more waking up with neck pain. After reading the reviews, apparently people are saying this is the same thing as the Coop pillow, but half the price, so I gave it a shot, and I gotta say Im pretty impressed. The inside has shredded memory foam, and they give you an extra bag you can put in if its still not firm enough. Im a side sleeper, and I ended up having to take some of the stuffing out to make it perfect. Super comfortable, and it doesnt sleep any hotter than any of the other pillows Ive ever had, but it also doesnt sleep any cooler. It has a washable outer pillowcase with a zipper, and per everyones recommendations, its best to wash the outer pillowcase cover before you put it on the inner pillowcase cover. There was a slight memory foam smell for a day or two, but it was barely noticeable, and washing the outer pillowcase first helps a lot. Get it, you wont be disappointed!"

Review text: These pillows are amazing!!! The shredded memory foam stays in great shape for an insanely long time. The pillows have a lot of memory foam in them when they come, so my wife and I took some out and put it in a small storage bag in our closet. PLUS it comes with extra memory foam to replace with. We’ve had these pillows for nearly twos years and are just now at the point where we need to replace the memory foam inside them. At this rate we will have enough to last us for another 6-8 years! I love the fact that I can make my pillow more firm by adding a little more memory foam to it. My wife likes her pillow thinner/softer, but I like mine a little thicker/more firm. It’s so easy to adjust for however you might like it! I’ve recommended these pillows to family and friends and they love them too!

The material and construction seem high quality, and the attention from product support made buying this pillow a good decision.

Review text: As a heavy guy with broad shoulders and a big head, I like my pillow to be extremely firm and have a high loft.  The dreamy blue pillow out of the box was much too flat and soft, and even after adding the extra bag of filler which included, it still was not firm enough.  I emailed Amy, whose contact information is found on an included information card, and she promptly sent out more filler to me at no extra cost.  The extra filler brought the firmness up to where I need it.  I highly recommend the DreamyBlue King size pillow.  The material and construction seem high quality, and the attention from product support made buying this pillow a good decision.

Review text: I wanted to like this so much (and the price was right on prime days), but I just had to return it., Per say nothing wrong with it, well made too:, It has three feather pillows inserts so you can adjust height. Personally 2 was plenty, or one with the size of the two would’ve been., The thing that didn’t work for me was the outer fluffy encasing. Totally useless for me., The set comes with an outer poly filled pillowcase (that you can also not use) which opens like a book via dual zippers. Great idea. In theory. Issue with that is that the fluff is so thick that you “loose” your feather pillows inside. I tried one pillow, and I tried two. One pillow wasn’t enough and two were too much. Which means the third one would be unnecessary., If I just decided not to use the “pillowcase” it would have been one extra thing to put in a closet or something to throw away. Waste of money and material, so I decided against it., I didn’t even sleep on it, I put a clean bed pillowcase on, laid my head on it, re-tried with two, then took it all out and put it back into its carry case and box, and off to return it went., Can’t rate comfort, sleep quality or support, since I didn’t use it., To make matters “funnier” when I first laid my head on it, the pillows slid up and away from me, like they were slick. LOL!, Again, nothing wrong with it, but is just not what I wanted.

Review text: These reviews are all over the place, which can almost make it impossible to decide on whether to order or not. I’m glad I went with my gut instinct., There is no excuse for not having a 4 star hotel experience every night, and with these pillows, you can achieve it easily! For a lot less than the price it would cost for a one night stay in an upscale hotel, you could buy these, adjust them to your preference, and sink into luxury! I’m particular about my pillows, and have been using the expensive down alternative kinds, but down and feather support and mold where you need it for maximum support. The expensive memory foam ones always gave me ear aches, and I remembered how nice it was to have down and feather pillows once upon a time. I have had neck pain so bad before these I was having to ice my neck every day. I woke up after using these miracle pillows, with zero neck pain and have my full mobility back. Overnight. So I ordered more. All my fake alternative pillows have been replaced with these real deal ones. I’m not saying they will work for everyone, but as the Lord is my witness, they’ve changed my situation. Not to mention how gushy and amazing they are! I’m glad I gave them a chance. Highly recommend!!!

Review text: Let me preface this with the fact that I work for The Company Store. If you go to their site, the pillows there are very very pricy, like $200-$300 pricy. So i was super duper skeptical about these but i was expecting a baby and i needed new pillows for what i thought would be decoration on my bed. No matter how we use them and how flat they get, they practically fluff themselves!!! Sometimes I’ll flatten one, use another and then next thing you know, it’s back to full shape. I’m a proud big girl and I just had a baby so support for my neck, shoulders and back are a big deal to me even when i was skinny and these do the trick and so freakin worth the money it’s crazy. Now that I’ve had them for over 6 months, I can testify to how worth the purchase they are. Typing this while on them right now lol. Also, never really gets too hot and i was a fat, pregnant chick in Florida. Getting hot when i sleep its just an issue I’ve come to accept so i thought it was important to add that detail.

Review text: Let me preface this with the fact that I work for The Company Store. If you go to their site, the pillows there are very very pricy, like $200-$300 pricy. So i was super duper skeptical about these but i was expecting a baby and i needed new pillows for what i thought would be decoration on my bed. No matter how we use them and how flat they get, they practically fluff themselves!!! Sometimes I’ll flatten one, use another and then next thing you know, it’s back to full shape. I’m a proud big girl and I just had a baby so support for my neck, shoulders and back are a big deal to me even when i was skinny and these do the trick and so freakin worth the money it’s crazy. Now that I’ve had them for over 6 months, I can testify to how worth the purchase they are. Typing this while on them right now lol. Also, never really gets too hot and i was a fat, pregnant chick in Florida. Getting hot when i sleep its just an issue I’ve come to accept so i thought it was important to add that detail.

Review text: "I have been searching for awhile for a pillow with the right amount of height and support. I had purchased these in the past in stores and remembered being happy with them so I purchased them again and what I received was a VERY different product. They come vacuum sealed and rolled up into cylinders (and you literally have to cut them out of the packaging so Im not sure how they accept returns...well find out). It took a couple of days for them to rebound enough to even distribute the material within the case and I had hope that the material would continue to relax as they were used but that hasnt happened at all after a month of use. They continue to be as hard as they were when they were received and have absolutely no give at all. You seriously may as well be trying to sleep on a cinder block. Theyre so hard you cant even try to manually reshape them. Im not sure if the material simply cant withstand the vacuum sealing process or if this is a completely different product that I had previously purchased. Woke up this morning with an extremely stiff and painful neck and decided it was time to give up on them. Will be trying to return but not sure how thats going to go because again youre not able to get them back into their package after you cut them out of it (I didnt keep it anyway because of that and my confidence that I would like this product because I had used it before)."

Review text: I had a Bamboo pillow for the longest time. Couldn’t remember where I got it. Thought I’d found the brand here. Logo looked right on the pillow. Apparently all these knock off companies use the same style logo and font and just put the word “Bamboo” on them. These pillows are seriously trash. Yes, I massaged them, waited 24 hrs (as instructed).. finally used them last night. One pillow alone is flat and feels stiff and uncomfortable, two feels somehow like two much and.. still uncomfortable. Don’t bother wasting your money. Idk what brand I had before, but it definitely wasn’t this company. I picked the firm feel but these aren’t adjustable, the filling doesn’t even feel full. Review text: "Its not a bad pillow, really, but the name is unfortunate, since it behaves nothing whatsoever like down. I actually came across these at a brick-and-mortar and liked how they felt when I squeezed them, but they were out of stock. Since Id already encountered them in person, I felt emboldened to buy them online. But what felt like down to my hands could not fool my head. The main quality that a down pillow has is that it molds around your head into a soft but supportive shape. These pillows were far too resilient: it always felt a bit like they were fighting me, pushing on my head. They simply didnt have enough give. So now I use them as clutch pillows, and I like them for that, but so far I havent found any substitute for a down pillow but a new down pillow."

These pillows were far too resilient: it always felt a bit like they were fighting me, pushing on my head.

Review text: Dawg, this is the best pillow I have ever owned., Bought it for my dad a while back, he never used it & sadly passed away. Upon cleaning his house out, lo and behold I find last year’s Christmas present (including these pillows). So of course I take the home & use them., The way they came packed was rolled up into a little tube shape, squished down hard, think - pack of tennis balls. I thought “what a stupid way to ship a pillow. This thing is gonna come out flat & suck.” The directions said to open, give it time, & then fluff the crap out of it & pull the stuffing apart. So that’s what I did., I’ve now been using them every night for the past year & my god.. it’s still like I just unpacked them. If they ever look a little sad, I just fluff-pull apart the stuffing & it’s just like new again. They have never gone flat & have redefined my definition for “a little sad” when referring to a pillow as this products “sad” is any other pillows brand new., It feels nice to be so wrong about something. I don’t think I’ll be buying any other brand pillows for a looong time.

I absolutely must have a firm pillow because I sleep on my side and soft pillows don't work....at least not for me.

This pillow allows you to adjust the firmness, or to make it a little softer by removing some of the foam inside.

My only complaint is that it says that you can "add" foam if needed.

Review text: Realizing that I needed a thicker pillow that supported my head at night without straining my neck, I looked into various pillow options. I love the idea of a shredded material as the filling. Down flattens too quickly and sometimes feather points stick out of the pillow. So shredded sponge-like material seemed great. Very happy with this product.

Review text: I have been a pillow connoisseur since second grade.  Feather pillows poked me though the fabric, and they deflated quickly. Until these new fillers came out, I used pillows stuffed with cotton, which inevitably clumped together into a very lumpy pillow., Some of the pillows that are using memory foam are too firm. Review text:
I absolutely must have a firm pillow because I sleep on my side and soft pillows don't work....at least not for me.

This pillow allows you to adjust the firmness, or to make it a little softer by removing some of the foam inside.

I originally purchased a casper pillow years ago and loved it.

It felt plush but supportive, similar to a down pillow.

But the product the pillow is now filled with has changed.

The pillow feels hard and unresponsive when I try to fluff or rearrange it to support my neck.

It’s just a solid “blob” of firmness, even after washing and fluffing.

Really, really disappointing.

Review text:
I originally purchased a casper pillow years ago and loved it.

It felt plush but supportive, similar to a down pillow.

But the product the pillow is now filled with has changed.

The pillow feels hard and unresponsive when I try to fluff or rearrange it to support my neck.

It’s just a solid “blob” of firmness, even after washing and fluffing.

Really, really disappointing.

Review text:
I was so surprised with how happy I am with these pillows.  

I would describe them as smooshygooshy but firm maintaining support.  

My favorite pillow for last 7 years has been a down one the I could form under neck before I went to sleep.  

I don’t like huge firm pillows that prop your whole body up with no give.

These give way to a space for your head or body to sink into, but still providing support.  

Love them
